General_title: Party to the Cartagena Protocol on Biosafety
General_questions0_title: Is your country a Party to the Cartagena Protocol on Biosafety (CPB)?
General_questions1_title: If your country is not a Party to the Cartagena Protocol on Biosafety (CPB), is there any national process in place towards becoming a Party?
General_questions2_title: Here you may provide further details:
Article2_description: Article 2 requires each Party to take the necessary and appropriate legal, administrative and other measures to implement its obligations under the Protocol
Article2_questions0_title: Has your country introduced the necessary national measures for the implementation of the Protocol?
Article2_questions0_options0_title: National measures are fully in place
Article2_questions0_options1_title: National measures are partially in place
Article2_questions0_options2_title: Only temporary measures have been introduced
Article2_questions0_options4_title: No measures have yet been taken
Article2_questions1_title: Which specific instruments are in place for the implementation of national biosafety measures? (select all that apply)
Article2_questions1_options0_title: One or more national biosafety laws
Article2_questions1_options1_title: One or more national biosafety regulations
Article2_questions1_options2_title: One or more sets of biosafety guidelines
Article2_questions1_options3_title: Other laws, regulations or guidelines that indirectly apply to biosafety
Article2_questions2_title: Has your country undertaken initiatives to mainstream biosafety into national biodiversity strategies and action plans, other policies, or legislation?
Article2_questions3_title: Has your country established a mechanism for budget allocations for the operation of its national biosafety measures?
Article2_questions4_title: Does your country have permanent staff to administer functions directly related to biosafety?
Article2_questions5_title: If you answered Yes to question 18, how many permanent staff members are in place whose functions are directly related to biosafety ?
Article2_questions7_title: Here you may provide further details on the implementation of Article 2 in your country
Article5_questions0_title: Does your country regulate the transboundary movement, handling or use of living modified organisms (LMOs) which are pharmaceuticals to humans?
Article5_questions1_title: Here you may provide further details on the implementation of Article 5 in your country
Article6_questions0_title: Does your country regulate the transit of LMOs?
Article6_questions1_title: Does your country regulate the contained use of LMOs?
Article6_questions2_title: Has your country taken a decision concerning the import of LMOs for contained use?
Article6_questions3_title: Here you may provide further details on the implementation of Article 6 in your country
Articles7_10_title: Articles 7 to 10 – Advance Informed Agreement (AIA) and intentional introduction of LMOs into the environment
Articles7_10_questions0_title: Has your country established legal requirements for exporters under its jurisdiction to notify in writing the competent national authority of the Party of import prior to the intentional transboundary movement of an LMO that falls within the scope of the AIA procedure?
Articles7_10_questions1_title: When acting as the Party of export, has your country established legal requirements for the accuracy of information contained in the notification provided by the exporter?
Articles7_10_questions1_options3_title: Not applicable (Party currently not exporting LMOs)
Articles7_10_questions2_title: In the current reporting period, has your country received a notification regarding intentional transboundary movements of LMOs for intentional introduction into the environment?
Articles7_10_questions3_title: If you answered Yes to question 29, did the notification(s) contain complete information (at a minimum the information specified in Annex I to the Cartagena Protocol on Biosafety)?
Articles7_10_questions4_title: If you answered Yes to question 29, has your country acknowledged receipt of the notification(s) to the notifier within ninety days of receipt?
Articles7_10_questions5_title: If you answered Yes to question 29, has your country informed of its decision(s)
Articles7_10_questions6_title: In the current reporting period, has your country taken a decision in response to the notification(s) regarding intentional transboundary movements of LMOs for intentional introduction into the environment?
Articles7_10_questions7_title: If you answered Yes to question 33, how many LMOs has your country approved for import for intentional introduction into the environment?
Articles7_10_questions8_title: If you answered under question 34 that LMOs were approved, have all these LMOs actually been imported into your country?
Articles7_10_questions9_title: If you answered Yes to question 33, what percentage of your country’s decisions fall into the following categories? (select all that apply)
Articles7_10_questions9_options0_title: Approval of the import/use of the LMO(s) without conditions
Articles7_10_questions9_options1_title: Approval of the import/use of the LMO(s) with conditions
Articles7_10_questions9_options2_title: Prohibition of the import/use of the LMO(s)
Articles7_10_questions9_options4_title: Inform the notifier that the period for communicating the decision has been extended
Articles7_10_questions10_title: If you answered under question 36 that your country has taken a decision to approve the import with conditions or to prohibit the import, were the reasons provided?
Articles7_10_questions11_title: Here you may provide further details on the implementation of Articles 7 to 10 in your country, including measures in case of lack of scientific certainty on potential adverse effects of LMOs for intentional introduction to the environment
Article11_title: Article 11 – Procedure for living modified organisms intended for direct use as food or feed, or for processing (LMOs-FFP)
Article11_questions0_title: Does your country have law(s), regulation(s) or administrative measures for decision-making regarding domestic use, including placing on the market, of LMOs that may be subject to transboundary movement for direct use as food or feed, or for processing?
Article11_questions1_title: Has your country established legal requirements for the accuracy of information to be provided by the applicant regarding the domestic use, including placing on the market, of LMOs that may be subject to transboundary movement for direct use as food or feed, or for processing?
Article11_questions2_title: In the current reporting period, how many decisions has your country taken <u>regarding domestic use</u>, including placing on the market, of LMOs that may be subject to transboundary movement for direct use as food or feed, or for processing?
Article11_questions3_title: Does your country have law(s), regulation(s) or administrative measures for decision-making regarding the import of LMOs for direct use as food or feed, or for processing?
Article11_questions4_title: In the current reporting period, how many decisions has your country taken <u>regarding the import</u> of LMOs for direct use as food or feed, or for processing?
Article11_questions5_title: Here you may provide further details on the implementation of Article 11 in your country, including measures in case of lack of scientific certainty on potential adverse effects of LMOs that may be subject to transboundary movement for direct use as food or feed, or for processing
Article12_questions0_title: Has your country established a mechanism for the review and change of a decision regarding an intentional transboundary movement of LMOs?
Article12_questions1_title: In the current reporting period, has your country reviewed and/or changed a decision regarding an intentional transboundary movement of an LMO?
Article12_questions2_title: If you answered Yes to question 46, how many decisions were reviewed and/or changed?
Article12_questions3_title: If you answered Yes to question 46, were any of the reviews triggered by a request from the Party of export or the notifier?
Article12_questions4_title: If you answered Yes to question 48, did your country provide a response within ninety days setting out the reasons for the decision?
Article12_questions5_title: If you answered Yes to question 46, were any of the reviews initiated by your country as the Party of import?
Article12_questions6_title: If you answered Yes to question 50, did your country, within thirty days, set out the reasons for the decision and inform
Article12_questions7_title: Here you may provide further details on the implementation of Article 12 in your country
Article13_questions0_title: Has your country established a mechanism for the application of the simplified procedure regarding an intentional transboundary movement of LMOs?
Article13_questions1_title: In the current reporting period, has your country applied the simplified procedure?
Article13_questions2_title: If you answered Yes to question 54, for how many LMOs has your country applied the simplified procedure?
Article13_questions3_title: If you answered Yes to question 54, has your country informed the Parties through the BCH of the cases where the simplified procedure was applied?
Article13_questions4_title: Here you may provide further details on the implementation of Article 13 in your country
Article14_title: Article 14 – Bilateral, regional and multilateral agreements and arrangements
Article14_questions0_title: How many bilateral, regional or multilateral agreements or arrangements relevant to biosafety has your country established with other Parties/non-Parties?
Article14_questions1_title: If you answered under question 58 that agreements or arrangements were established, please provide a brief description of their scope and objective
Article14_questions2_title: Here you may provide further details on the implementation of Article 14 in your country
Article15_16_title: Articles 15 & 16 – Risk Assessment and Risk Management
Article15_16_questions0_title: Does the domestic regulatory framework of your country require risk assessments of LMOs to be conducted?
Article15_16_questions1_title: If you answered Yes to question 61, with regard to which LMOs does the requirement apply (select all that apply)?
Article15_16_questions1_options0_title: For imports of LMOs for intentional introduction into the environment
Article15_16_questions1_options1_title: For imports of LMOs intended for direct use as food or feed, or for processing
Article15_16_questions1_options2_title: For decisions regarding domestic use, including placing on the market, of LMOs that may be subject to transboundary movements for direct use as food or feed, or for processing
Article15_16_questions1_options3_title: For imports of LMOs for contained use
Article15_16_questions2_title: Has your country established a mechanism to conduct risk assessments prior to taking decisions regarding LMOs?
Article15_16_questions3_title: If you answered Yes to question 63, does the mechanism include procedures to identify and/or train national experts to conduct risk assessments?
Article15_16_questions4_title: Capacity-building in risk assessment or risk management
Article15_16_questions5_title: How many people in your country have been trained in risk assessment, risk management and monitoring of LMOs?
Article15_16_questions6_title: Is your country using training material and/or technical guidance for training in risk assessment and risk management of LMOs?
Article15_16_questions7_title: If you answered Yes to question 66, is your country using the “Manual on Risk Assessment of LMOs” (developed by the CBD Secretariat) for training in risk assessment?
Article15_16_questions8_title: If you answered Yes to question 66, is your country using the “Guidance on Risk Assessment of LMOs” (developed by the Online Forum and the AHTEG on Risk Assessment and Risk Management) for training in risk assessment?
Article15_16_questions9_title: Does your country have specific needs for further guidance on specific topics of risk assessment of LMOs?
Article15_16_questions10_title: Does your country have the capacity to detect, identify, assess the risk of and/or monitor living modified organisms or specific traits that may have adverse effects on the conservation and sustainable use of biological diversity, taking into account risks to human health?
Article15_16_questions12_title: Has your country adopted or used any guidance documents for the purpose of conducting risk assessment or risk management, or for evaluating risk assessment reports submitted by notifiers?
Article15_16_questions13_title: If you answered Yes to question 71, is your country using the “Guidance on Risk Assessment of LMOs” (developed by the Online Forum and the AHTEG on Risk Assessment and Risk Management) for conducting risk assessment or risk management, or for evaluating risk assessment reports submitted by notifiers?
Article15_16_questions14_title: Has your country adopted common approaches or methodologies to risk assessment in coordination with other countries?
Article15_16_questions15_title: Has your country cooperated with other Parties with a view to identifying LMOs or specific traits that may have adverse effects on the conservation and sustainable use of biological diversity?
Article15_16_questions16_title: In the current reporting period, has your country conducted any kind of risk assessment of LMOs, including for contained use, field trials, commercial purposes, direct use as food, feed, or for processing?
Article15_16_questions17_title: If you answered Yes to question 75, how many risk assessments were conducted?
Article15_16_questions18_title: If you answered Yes to question 75, please indicate the scope of the risk assessments (select all that apply)
Article15_16_questions18_options0_title: LMOs for contained use (in accordance with Article 3)
Article15_16_questions18_options1_title: LMOs for intentional introduction into the environment for experimental testing or field trials
Article15_16_questions18_options2_title: LMOs for intentional introduction into the environment for commercial purposes
Article15_16_questions18_options3_title: LMOs for direct use as food
Article15_16_questions18_options4_title: LMOs for direct use as feed
Article15_16_questions19_title: If you answered Yes to question 75, were risk assessments conducted for all decisions taken on LMOs for intentional introduction into the environment or on domestic use of LMOs that may be subject to transboundary movement for direct use as food or feed, or for processing?
Article15_16_questions20_title: Has your country established appropriate mechanisms, measures and strategies to regulate and manage risks identified in the risk assessment of LMOs?
Article15_16_questions21_title: Has your country taken appropriate measures to prevent unintentional transboundary movements of LMOs, including such measures as requiring a risk assessment to be carried out prior to the first release of a LMO?
Article15_16_questions22_title: Has your country taken measures to ensure that any LMO, whether imported or locally developed, undergoes an appropriate period of observation that is commensurate with its life-cycle or generation time before it is put to its intended use?
Article15_16_questions23_title: Has your country established a mechanism for monitoring potential effects of LMOs released into the environment?
Article15_16_questions24_title: Does your country have the necessary infrastructure (e.g. laboratory facilities) for monitoring or managing LMOs?
Article15_16_questions25_title: Here you may provide further details on the implementation of Articles 15 and 16 in your country
Article17_title: Article 17 – Unintentional transboundary movements<sup>2</sup>  and emergency measures
Article17_footnote: <sup>2</sup> In accordance with the operational definition adopted in decision CP-VIII/16, “‘Unintentional transboundary movement’ is a transboundary movement of a living modified organism that has inadvertently crossed the national borders of a Party where the living modified organism was released, and the requirements of Article 17 of the Protocol apply to such transboundary movements only if the living modified organism involved is likely to have significant adverse effects on the conservation and sustainable use of biological diversity, taking also into account risks to human health, in the affected or potentially affected States.”
Article17_questions0_title: Has your country established measures to notify affected or potentially affected States, the Biosafety Clearing-House and, where appropriate, relevant international organizations in case of a release under its jurisdiction that leads, or may lead, to an unintentional transboundary movement?
Article17_questions1_title: In the current reporting period, how many releases of LMOs occurred under your country’s jurisdiction that led, or may have led, to an unintentional transboundary movement?
Article17_questions2_title: If you answered under question 86 that a release occurred, has your country notified affected or potentially affected States, the Biosafety Clearing-House and, where appropriate, relevant international organizations?
Article17_questions3_title: Does your country have the capacity to take appropriate response measures in response to unintentional transboundary movements?
Article17_questions4_title: In the current reporting period, how many times has your country become aware of an unintentional transboundary movement into its territory?
Article17_questions5_title: Here you may provide further details on the implementation of Article 17 in your country
Article18_title: Article 18 – Handling, transport, packaging and identification
Article18_questions0_title: Has your country taken measures to require that LMOs that are subject to transboundary movement are handled, packaged and transported under conditions of safety, taking into account relevant international rules and standards?
Article18_questions1_title: Has your country taken measures to require that documentation accompanying LMOs-FFP, in cases where the identity of the LMOs is not known, clearly identifies that they may contain LMOs and are not intended for intentional introduction into the environment, as well as a contact point for further information?
Article18_questions2_title: Has your country taken measures to require that documentation accompanying LMOs-FFP, in cases where the identity of the LMOs is known, clearly identifies that they contain LMOs and are not intended for intentional introduction into the environment, as well as a contact point for further information?
Article18_questions3_title: If you answered Yes to question(s) 91, 92 and/or 93, what type of documentation accompanying LMOs does your country require?
Article18_questions3_options1_title: As part of other documentation (not specific for LMOs)
Article18_questions4_title: Has your country taken measures to require that documentation accompanying LMOs that are destined for contained use clearly identifies them as LMOs and specifies any requirements for the safe handling, storage, transport and use, the contact point for further information, including the name and address of the individual and institution to whom the LMO are consigned?
Article18_questions5_title: If you answered Yes to question 95, what type of documentation does your country require for the identification of LMOs that are destined for contained use?
Article18_questions5_options1_title: As part of other documentation (not specific for LMOs)
Article18_questions6_title: Has your country taken measures to require that documentation accompanying LMOs that are intended for intentional introduction into the environment of the Party of import clearly identifies them as living modified organisms; specifies the identity and relevant traits and/or characteristics, any requirements for the safe handling, storage, transport and use, the contact point for further information and, as appropriate, the name and address of the importer and exporter; and contains a declaration that the movement is in conformity with the requirements of this Protocol applicable to the exporter?
Article18_questions7_title: If you answered Yes to question 97, what type of documentation does your country require for the identification of LMOs that are intended for intentional introduction into the environment?
Article18_questions7_options1_title: As part of other documentation (not specific for LMOs)
Article18_questions8_title: Does your country have available any guidance for the purpose of ensuring the safe handling, transport, and packaging of living modified organisms?
Article18_questions9_title: Does your country have the capacity to enforce the requirements of identification and documentation of LMOs?
Article18_questions10_title: How many customs officers in your country have received training in the identification of LMOs?
Article18_questions12_title: Has your country established procedures for the sampling and detection of LMOs?
Article18_questions13_title: How many laboratory personnel in your country have received training in detection of LMOs?
Article18_questions15_title: Does your country have reliable access to laboratory facilities for the detection of LMOs?
Article18_questions16_title: How many laboratories in your country are certified for LMO detection?
Article18_questions17_title: If you answered under question 105 that certified laboratories exist in your country, how many of them are currently operating in the detection of LMOs?
Article18_questions18_title: Here you may provide further details on the implementation of Article 18 in your country
Article19_title: Article 19 – Competent National Authorities and National Focal Points
Article19_questions0_title: In case your country has designated more than one competent national authority, has your country established a mechanism for the coordination of their actions prior to taking decisions regarding LMOs?
Article19_questions0_options2_title: Not applicable (no competent national authority was designated)
Article19_questions0_options3_title: Not applicable (only one competent national authority was designated)
Article19_questions1_title: Has your country established adequate institutional capacity to enable the competent national authority(ies) to perform the administrative functions required by the Cartagena Protocol on Biosafety?
Article19_questions2_title: Has your country undertaken initiatives to strengthen collaboration among national focal points, competent national authority(ies) and other institutions on biosafety-related matters?

Article22_questions12_title: Has your country developed a capacity-building strategy or action plan?
Article22_questions13_title: Does your country have in place a functional national mechanism for coordinating biosafety capacity-building initiatives?
Article22_questions14_title: Here you may provide further details on the implementation of Article 22 in your country, including further details about your experience in accessing GEF funds:
Article23_questions0_title: Is biosafety public awareness, education and/or participation addressed in legislation or policy in your country?
Article23_questions1_title: In the current reporting period, has your country cooperated with other States and international bodies in relation to public awareness, education and participation?
Article23_questions2_title: Has your country established a mechanism to ensure public access to information on LMOs?
Article23_questions3_title: Does your country have in place a national communication strategy on biosafety?
Article23_questions4_title: Does your country have any awareness and outreach programmes on biosafety?
Article23_questions5_title: Does your country currently have a national biosafety website?
Article23_questions6_title: How many academic institutions in your country are offering biosafety education and training courses and programmes?
Article23_questions8_title: How many educational materials and/or online modules on biosafety are available and accessible to the public in your country?
Article23_questions10_title: Has your country established a mechanism to consult the public in the decision-making process regarding LMOs?
Article23_questions11_title: Has your country informed the public about existing modalities for public participation in the decision-making process regarding LMOs?
Article23_questions12_title: If you answered Yes to question 148, please indicate the modalities used to inform the public: (select all that apply)
Article23_questions13_title: In the current reporting period, how many times has your country consulted the public in the decision-making process regarding LMOs?
Article23_questions14_title: Has your country informed the public about the means to access the Biosafety Clearing-House?
Article23_questions15_title: Here you may provide further details on the implementation of Article 23 in your country
Article24_questions0_title: Has your country entered into any bilateral, regional, or multilateral agreement with non-Parties regarding transboundary movements of LMOs?
Article24_questions1_title: In the current reporting period, has your country imported LMOs from a non-Party?
Article24_questions2_title: In the current reporting period, has your country exported LMOs to a non-Party?
Article24_questions3_title: If you answered Yes to question 154 and/or 155, were the transboundary movements of LMOs consistent with the objective of the Cartagena Protocol on Biosafety?
Article24_questions4_title: Here you may provide further details on the implementation of Article 24 in your country
Article25_footnote: <sup>3</sup>In accordance with the operational definition adopted in decision CP VIII/16, “‘Illegal transboundary movement’ is a transboundary movement of living modified organisms carried out in contravention of the domestic measures to implement the Protocol that have been adopted by the Party concerned”.
Article25_questions0_title: Has your country adopted domestic measures aimed at preventing and/or penalizing transboundary movements of LMOs carried out in contravention of its domestic measures to implement the Cartagena Protocol?
Article25_questions1_title: In the current reporting period, how many cases of illegal transboundary movements of LMOs has your country become aware of?
Article25_questions2_title: If you indicated under question 159 that your country became aware of cases of illegal transboundary movements, has the origin of the LMO(s) been established?
Article25_questions3_title: Here you may provide further details on the implementation of Article 25 in your country
Article26_questions0_title: Does your country have any specific approaches or requirements that facilitate how socioeconomic considerations should be taken into account in LMO decision-making?
Article26_questions1_title: In the current reporting period, have socioeconomic considerations arising from the impact of LMOs been taken into account in decision-making?
Article26_questions2_title: How many peer-reviewed published materials has your country used for the purpose of elaborating or determining national actions with regard to socioeconomic considerations?
Article26_questions4_title: Has your country cooperated with other Parties on research and information exchange on any socioeconomic impacts of LMOs?
Article26_questions5_title: Here you may provide further details on the implementation of Article 26 in your country
Article28_questions0_title: In the current reporting period, how much funding (in the equivalent of US dollars) has your country mobilized to support implementation of the Cartagena Protocol beyond the regular national budgetary allocation?
Article33_description: Article 33 requires Parties to monitor the implementation of its obligations under the Cartagena Protocol and to report to the Conference of the Parties serving as the meeting of the Parties to the Cartagena Protocol on measures taken to implement the Protocol
Article33_questions0_title: Does your country have in place a system to monitor and enforce the implementation of the Cartagena Protocol?
LiabilityRedress_title: Nagoya-Kuala Lumpur Supplementary Protocol on Liability and Redress
LiabilityRedress_description: Parties to the Cartagena Protocol that are not yet Party to the Supplementary Protocol are also invited to respond to the questions below
LiabilityRedress_questions0_title: Is your country a Party to the Nagoya-Kuala Lumpur Supplementary Protocol on Liability and Redress?
LiabilityRedress_questions1_title: If you answered No to question 169, is there any national process in place towards becoming a Party to the Supplementary Protocol?
LiabilityRedress_questions2_title: Has your country introduced the necessary measures for the implementation of the Supplementary Protocol?
LiabilityRedress_questions2_options0_tit: National measures are fully in place
LiabilityRedress_questions2_options1_tit: National measures are partially in place
LiabilityRedress_questions2_options2_tit: Only temporary measures have been introduced
LiabilityRedress_questions2_options4_tit: No measures have yet been taken
LiabilityRedress_questions3_title: Which instruments are in place for the implementation of the Supplementary Protocol?
LiabilityRedress_questions3_options2_tit: One or more sets of guidelines
LiabilityRedress_questions4_title: Does your country have administrative or legal instruments that require response measures to be taken
LiabilityRedress_questions4_questions0_t: In case of damage resulting from LMOs?
LiabilityRedress_questions4_questions1_t: In case there is sufficient likelihood that damage will result if response measures are not taken?
LiabilityRedress_questions5_title: If you answered Yes to question 173a, do these instruments impose requirements on an operator (select all that apply)?
LiabilityRedress_questions5_options0_tit: Yes, the operator must inform the competent authority of the damage
LiabilityRedress_questions5_options1_tit: Yes, the operator must evaluate the damage
LiabilityRedress_questions5_options2_tit: Yes, the operator must take response measures
LiabilityRedress_questions6_title: If you answered Yes to question 173a, do these instruments require the operator to take response measures to avoid damage?
LiabilityRedress_questions7_title: If you answered Yes to question 173a or 173b, do these instruments provide for a definition of “operator”?
LiabilityRedress_questions8_title: If you answered Yes to question 176, which of the following could be an ‘operator’ (select all that apply)?
LiabilityRedress_questions8_options1_tit: Person who placed the LMO on the market
LiabilityRedress_questions9_title: Has a competent authority been identified for carrying out the functions set out in the Supplementary Protocol?
LiabilityRedress_questions10_title: If you answered Yes to question 178, what measures may the competent authority take (select all that apply)?
LiabilityRedress_questions10_options0_ti: Identify the operator that caused the damage
LiabilityRedress_questions10_options2_ti: Determine response measures to be taken by operator
LiabilityRedress_questions10_options4_ti: Recover costs and expenses of the evaluation of the damage and the implementation of any response measures from the operator
LiabilityRedress_questions11_title: Does your country have measures in place to provide for financial security for damage resulting from LMOs?
LiabilityRedress_questions12_title: If you answered Yes to question 180, what type of financial security measures are in place (select all that apply)?
LiabilityRedress_questions12_options0_ti: Requirement to provide evidence for secure source of funding
LiabilityRedress_questions13_title: Does your country have rules and procedures on civil liability that address damage resulting from LMOs, or has such damage been recognized in court rulings (select all that apply)?
LiabilityRedress_questions13_options0_ti: Yes, in a civil liability instrument
LiabilityRedress_questions14_title: Have there been any occurrences of damage resulting from LMOs in your country?
LiabilityRedress_questions15_title: If you answered Yes to question 183, have response measures been taken?
LiabilityRedress_questions16_title: Here you may provide further details on any activities undertaken in your country towards the implementation of the Nagoya-Kuala Lumpur Supplementary Protocol on Liability and Redress
AdditionalInformation_questions0_title: Please use this field to provide any other information on issues related to national implementation of the Protocol, including any obstacles or impediments encountered.
Comments_questions0_title: Please use this field to provide any other information on difficulties that you have encountered in filling in this report.
